suncertify.db
Class LocalClient

java.lang.Object
  suncertify.db.LocalClient
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, DBClient
public class LocalClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements DBClient

Gives implementation to the methods which the client will call when booking or searching for hotel rooms.

bookHotelRoom

public boolean bookHotelRoom(java.lang.String owner,
                             HotelRoom room)
                      throws RecordNotFoundException,
                             java.lang.SecurityException,
                             java.io.IOException
Called when a client books a record and for that matter a hotel room.

Specified by:
bookHotelRoom in interface DBClient
Parameters:
owner - the ownerID of the client booking the hotel room
room - the hotel room to be booked
Returns:
true if hotel room is booked successful, false if otherwise
Throws:
RecordNotFoundException - if hotel room cannot be found using its associated record number in the database file.
java.lang.SecurityException - if the client is not the one who locked the room
java.io.IOException - The IOException is declared in order to be able to throw a RemoteException when running in networked mode.

checkRoomAvailability

public boolean checkRoomAvailability(HotelRoom room)
Checks the availability of a hotel room to be booked. This check is based on the ownerId of the hotel room and 48 hours of the start of this room's occupancy ( 48 hour booking rule). With 48 hour rule, it is assumed that all the record's time of start of room occupancy is 00:00:00 BST. Hence any second or minute past this time makes a difference. It is also assumed that the client is booking a room at this current System date and time, hence the current date and time is used for the booking.

Specified by:
checkRoomAvailability in interface DBClient
Parameters:
room - the room to be booked
Returns:
true if the is not already booked with an ownerId and the booking time is within 48 hours of the start of the room occupancy, false if otherwise.
